subject: Money Management & Credit Wisdom
prerequisites: Foundational literacy in the subject area

modules.title: Module 1: Budgeting and Cash-Flow Discipline
objectives: Build and maintain a realistic monthly budget.
Track income, fixed costs, and variable spending patterns.
Apply emergency-fund rules to reduce short-term financial risk.
Build monthly budgets

lessons.title: Module 1: Budgeting and Cash-Flow Discipline - Conceptual Grounding
objectives: Build and maintain a realistic monthly budget.
Track income, fixed costs, and variable spending patterns.
practiceSpecs: Short-form concept checks mapped to learning objectives.
masteryCheckSpecs: 2 conceptual prompts requiring explanation of reasoning.

lessons.title: Module 1: Budgeting and Cash-Flow Discipline - Problem Solving and Application
objectives: Track income, fixed costs, and variable spending patterns.
Apply emergency-fund rules to reduce short-term financial risk.
practiceSpecs: Guided problem set with increasing difficulty.
Reflection checkpoint connecting methods to outcomes.
masteryCheckSpecs: 1 applied scenario requiring method selection and justification.

projectSpecs: Create a 30-day cash-flow plan with spending categories and adjustment triggers.

modules.title: Module 2: Credit Reports, Scores, and Healthy Utilization
objectives: Interpret key components of consumer credit reports.
Explain credit score drivers and responsible utilization behavior.
Identify and dispute common reporting errors using compliant processes.
Build monthly budgets

lessons.title: Module 2: Credit Reports, Scores, and Healthy Utilization - Conceptual Grounding
objectives: Interpret key components of consumer credit reports.
Explain credit score drivers and responsible utilization behavior.
practiceSpecs: Short-form concept checks mapped to learning objectives.
masteryCheckSpecs: 2 conceptual prompts requiring explanation of reasoning.

lessons.title: Module 2: Credit Reports, Scores, and Healthy Utilization - Problem Solving and Application
objectives: Explain credit score drivers and responsible utilization behavior.
Identify and dispute common reporting errors using compliant processes.
practiceSpecs: Guided problem set with increasing difficulty.
Reflection checkpoint connecting methods to outcomes.
masteryCheckSpecs: 1 applied scenario requiring method selection and justification.

projectSpecs: Draft a personal credit improvement plan with utilization and payment targets.

modules.title: Module 3: Debt Strategy and Repayment Systems
objectives: Compare debt snowball and avalanche repayment strategies.
Calculate repayment impacts of APR, minimum payments, and term length.
Apply decision criteria for debt consolidation and refinancing.
Build monthly budgets

lessons.title: Module 3: Debt Strategy and Repayment Systems - Conceptual Grounding
objectives: Compare debt snowball and avalanche repayment strategies.
Calculate repayment impacts of APR, minimum payments, and term length.
practiceSpecs: Short-form concept checks mapped to learning objectives.
masteryCheckSpecs: 2 conceptual prompts requiring explanation of reasoning.

lessons.title: Module 3: Debt Strategy and Repayment Systems - Problem Solving and Application
objectives: Calculate repayment impacts of APR, minimum payments, and term length.
Apply decision criteria for debt consolidation and refinancing.
practiceSpecs: Guided problem set with increasing difficulty.
Reflection checkpoint connecting methods to outcomes.
masteryCheckSpecs: 1 applied scenario requiring method selection and justification.

projectSpecs: Build a debt payoff model and justify strategy selection with assumptions.

modules.title: Module 4: Consumer Protection and Long-Term Financial Habits
objectives: Identify major consumer financial rights and complaint pathways.
Apply fraud prevention and identity protection practices.
Design a 12-month habit plan for saving, credit maintenance, and risk control.
Build monthly budgets

objectives: Identify major consumer financial rights and complaint pathways.

practiceSpecs: Short-form concept checks mapped to learning objectives.

objectives: Apply fraud prevention and identity protection practices.
Design a 12-month habit plan for saving, credit maintenance, and risk control.
practiceSpecs: Guided problem set with increasing difficulty.
